New Records: Taskin Ahmed took four wickets for 25 runs, his best in T20Is
Key Match Events: Netherlands lost two wickets in the first two balls of their innings
Taskin's pace looked too good for the Netherlands batters
Colin Ackermann came up with a heroic knock for the Netherlands, but it was not enough for them
Soumya Sarkar defended the last over, conceding 14 runs with a six and a wicket off the last ball of the match
Post-Match Reflections: The Bangladesh team will be full of confidence to play their second T20 World Cup 2022 match against South Africa on October 27 in Sydney
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bangladesh posted 144 for eight in their innings
The Netherlands innings eventually ended up at 135 in 20 overs
Afif Hossain scored 38 runs, Shanto posted the second highest score of 25 runs
Mosaddek Hossain scored 20 off 12 balls and helped Bangladesh post a fighting total
Others: The match was played on October 24, 2022, at the Bellerive Oval, Hobart
Paul van Meekeren and Bas de Leede took two wickets each for the Netherlands
